an4.7:1.1: “Mendicants, these four competent, educated, assured, learned people—who have memorized the teachings and practice in line with the teachings—beautify the Saṅgha.
an4.7:1.7: These four competent, educated, assured, learned people—who have memorized the teachings and practice in line with the teachings—beautify the Saṅgha.
an4.7:2.2: learned, a memorizer of the teachings,
an4.7:2.3: who lives in line with the teachings—
an4.7:2.4: such a person is said to beautify the Saṅgha.
an4.7:3.6: they are the beautifiers of the Saṅgha.”
